derivation: a primitive root (apparently akin (by transmission) to H7901 (שָׁכַב) through the idea of lodging; compare H5531 (סִכְלוּת), H7925 (שָׁכַם));
outline:
1. to settle down, abide, dwell, tabernacle, reside
    1. (Qal)
      1. to settle down to abide
      2. to abide, dwell, reside
    2. (Piel)
      1. to make settle down, establish
      2. to make or cause to dwell
    3. (Hiphil)
      1. to lay, place, set, establish, settle, fix
      2. to cause to dwell or abide
kjv_def: abide, continue, (cause to, make to) dwell(-er), have habitation, inhabit, lay, place, (cause to) remain, rest, set (up).
strongs_def: to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
